g.text: Change the config to your liking
You can play around with the live version:
Draw a line from the center to the the edge of the circle
Calculate the wedge angle (360 / number of options)
Rotate the line by wedge angle x the index of the line
Draw the text of the option
Rotate the text by wedge angle x the (index of the text + 0.5)
This will place the text in the middle of the slice
Draw a line from the center to the the edge of the hexagon
Add the text descriptions and values for each corner
Draw the value of each attribute
Defining the point for each attribute in a
Provides a way to animate an attribute of an element over time.
Provides a way to define how an element moves along a motion path.
Animates a transformation attribute on its target element, allowing
animations to control translation, scaling, rotation, and/or skewing.

tr.td: âŒ Limited for intricate SVG-specific animations
âŒ Harder to manage inside SVG
âŒ Limited unless using JS or Motion Path

g.text: We are going to make use of the
The first proposed SVG file format was in 1994 by a Dutch software engineer Martijn Koster.
It wasn't until 2003 that the SVG file format was finalised and approved as an ISO standard.

g.g: Introduction What is an SVG? How does it compare to other image formats? ,How is it made?
Features & Considerations A deep dive on the inner workings and what some of the ,concerns or negatives are when using SVGs.

g.text: Examples of clever ways to use SVGs.
An explanation of why they are great
